The 3-sea race soon fully subscribed
Stavanger: Sunday evening there were 79 tickets left for the 3-sea race. - The festival will be sold out, race leader Johannes √òkland warns.
03 Nov 2019, 21:00 by Elisabeth Bie
- As of today we have sold 2421 tickets. We have 79 left and will be sold out, says Johannes √òkland, runner-up in GTI Athletics Club, which organizes the 3-Sj√∏ersl√∏pet, and Stavanger Marathon.
This year, the 3-Sj√∏ersl√∏pet will be held on Saturday, November 9, a week later than usual.
Last year, 2403 runners participated in the 3-sea race around Mosvatnet, Store Stokkavatnet and H√•landsvatnet, according to the race's website. There were 550 more than in 2017. The record is still 2565 participants in 2016.
- This year we have set a ceiling of 2500 participants to get the right quality for the event. Two to three weeks before the race, we put a roof on account of finances and the environment. We cannot burn in with prizes and equipment that we must throw afterwards, explains √òkland.


Johannes √òkland, head of the GTI Athletics Club.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Looked dark
Registration for the 3-sea race did not accelerate until after the Ryfast race.

See the giant photo gallery from the Ryfast race.

- Until Ryfastl√∏pet was finished a month ago, it was very bad registration, but it picked up sharply in the aftermath. We see that many were in the mode to sign up after they had completed Ryfast. We had to reorder premiums to accommodate more, says √òkland.
The 3-sea race has been the largest race in the district with an attendance of around 2500 on average, but this year was bypassed by the Ryfast race where 7500 were registered and 5331 started.


On Saturday, November 9, it is ready for another race party in Stavanger: the 3-Sj√∏ersl√∏pet. Here from last year's race.üì∑ Anders Minge

- This will be a popular party with a lot of audience and a good atmosphere on the trail. We hope for the sun and the calm, but people are usually prepared for bad weather this season, √òkland believes.
The long-term forecast at Yr reports sun, weak winds and five degrees. Nothing to complain about in November.
14 experienced speed holders help drag runners around the three lakes.
The race was organized for the first time in 2006, with 137 participants. The following year, participation increased to 140.
